Feeder fishing is a technique that uses a feeder to attract fish to the fishing spot. It\'s ideal for catching carp, bream and other cyprinids in still waters.
Casting is a sport fishing modality that focuses on casting precision. It\'s practiced in both fresh and salt water, targeting predators like pike, perch or black bass.
Spinning is an active fishing technique with artificial lures. It allows covering large water extensions and is very effective for catching predators like trout, pike and perch.
Fly fishing is an art that imitates the insects that fish feed on. It requires specific casting technique and is especially popular for trout and salmon fishing.

The spoon is one of the most classic and effective lures for predator fishing. Its oval and concave shape allows it to spin on itself during retrieval, creating vibrations and flashes that attract fish.

Main characteristics:
• Easy to use for beginners
• Effective in both clear and murky waters
• Ideal for trout, perch and pike
• Works well at different retrieval speeds

Usage technique:
Cast the spoon and start a constant retrieval. Vary the speed according to fish activity. On cold days, retrieve more slowly.

The popper is a surface lure designed to imitate an injured fish or insect on the water surface. Its characteristic concave mouth creates splashes and noise when moved.

Main characteristics:
• Floating surface lure
• Creates lots of noise and splashes
• Ideal for calm waters at dawn and dusk
• Very effective for black bass and pike
• Very exciting visual fishing

Usage technique:
Cast near structures and wait for the water to calm down. Make short, sharp jerks followed by pauses. The attack usually occurs during the pause.

The jig is one of the most versatile lures in fishing. It consists of a weighted head with hook, often complemented with rubbers, soft plastics or feathers.

Main characteristics:
• Extremely versatile
• Allows fishing at any depth
• Can be used with multiple techniques
• Effective all year round
• Perfectly imitates crabs and injured fish

Usage technique:
Let the jig reach the bottom and make short vertical movements. You can also drag it slowly or make jumps on the bottom. The key is to maintain constant contact with the lure.

The spinnerbait is a unique lure with one or more spinning blades mounted on a V-shaped wire. It's very effective for fishing in dense vegetation.

Main characteristics:
• Spinning blades create vibrations
• Weedless design
• Works well in vegetation
• Attracts fish from great distance
• Ideal for black bass and pike

Usage technique:
Retrieve at constant speed keeping it just below the surface or at mid-water. You can make occasional pauses so the blades stop spinning momentarily.

The crankbait is a hard lure that imitates small fish. Its front lip allows it to dive to different depths depending on the design.

Main characteristics:
• Perfectly imitates small fish
• Available for different depths
• Very attractive erratic movement
• Effective in open waters
• Ideal for covering lots of water quickly

Usage technique:
Retrieve at constant speed to maintain desired depth. Occasionally you can make jerks so the lure changes direction abruptly.

Soft plastic lures are extremely versatile and realistic. Their soft texture makes them very attractive to fish.

Main characteristics:
• Very realistic texture and movement
• Can be rigged in multiple ways
• Available in countless shapes and colors
• Effective with finesse techniques
• Ideal for wary fish

Usage technique:
Can be used with Texas, Carolina, Drop Shot rigs, etc. The key is to impart subtle and natural movements. They are especially effective in clear waters and with educated fish.
